intro: Carallia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean carallia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, displaying shades of purple and white. Carallia borneensis is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its habitat.
